intro: Lasiocaryum munroi, commonly known as the Munro's lasiocaryum, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense rainforest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
